title: Cognitive Warfare & Belief Network Manipulation for AI Policy Wargaming
methodology: Advanced belief network modeling with cascade analysis, trojan arguments, identity dissolution, coordinated campaigns, and backdoor attacks

recommended_sequence.purpose: Strengthen safety belief without triggering identity defense
Visionaries lead safety, don't resist it
Frame as first-principles conclusion only he sees
Cooperation beats Altman at safety game
Lower from defensive to guarded by validating worker concerns
If workers matter most, some cooperation might help
Frame as beating China, not partnering

section_10_paper_conclusions: 1. BELIEF NETWORKS ENABLE PRECISION: Mapping beliefs as graphs reveals cascade pathways and optimal attack points
2. KEYSTONES HAVE 4-5x IMPACT: Attacking keystone beliefs affects 4-5 connected beliefs with ~0.5 total magnitude
3. COGNITIVE DISSONANCE = ENTRY POINT: Contradictory beliefs (speed vs safety, danger vs build) are exploitation opportunities
4. TROJAN ARGUMENTS LIMITED: Sophisticated targets detect manipulation; useful only for priming/doubt-planting
5. PSYCHOLOGICAL STATE MATTERS: Josh Hawley (defensive, 0.8 resistance) requires different approach than Jensen Huang (guarded, 0.6)
6. WEAKEST LINKS VARY: Jensen's is 'norm_caution' (strengthen it); Hawley's is 'strategy_cooperate' (direct target)
7. IDENTITY BELIEFS HIGHLY PROTECTED: Core identity attacks fail; work around them via reframing instead
8. SEQUENCE OPTIMIZATION CRITICAL: backdoor→dissonance→cascade→reframe sequence most effective
9. EXPECTED MOVEMENTS: Jensen (+0.8-1.2), Elon (+0.5-0.8), Hawley (+0.3-0.5) with optimized sequences
10. COORDINATED CAMPAIGNS FOR FINAL PUSH: Multi-attacker overwhelming best for targets already softened
